newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador's Alarcon replaces two cabinet ministers.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's Alarcon replaces two cabinet ministers.

text.p: Ecuadorean President Fabian Alarcon said on Monday he had accepted the resignations of his ministers for health and public works.
He told reporters that Health Minister Guillermo Wagner would be replaced by Asdrubal de la Torre and Public Works Minister Estuardo Hidalgo by Homero Torres.
The changes were made to "make the government more dynamic," Alarcon said.
The other cabinet members were confirmed in their positions, he said.
Following local tradition, the entire cabinet resigned last week after a referendum in which Ecuadoreans voted to confirm the presidency of Alarcon.
Alarcon was appointed interim president until August 1998 by Congress in February, after former President Abdala Bucaram was deposed on grounds of "mental incapacity."
